item.title: Pretty printing OpenSAML Objects
item.description: In the best of worlds it's not often you need to look into the actual XML of a SAML message. In the real world however, when troubleshooting a problem, there is often leads to be found by looking at the XML of the SAML message. Lets have a look on how to go about doing that in OpenSAML 4. First let's create a OpenSAML object so we have something to print.

item.title: Signing and verifying signatures with OpenSAML 4
item.description: One of the most important things in SAML communication is signing. Digital signatures allow the receiver of a message to be sure that the message has not changed since it was sent by the sender. If not for digital signatures someone in the middle of the SAML communication could for example change what user was authenticated in the SAML assertion from the IdP. Digital signatures are also used to authenticate the sender sending a message.
